modal_info_title: Stream Water Flow Forecast - Aditional information
modal_info_paraghaph01: Brazilian edaphoclimatic conditions do not allow the use of forecasting methods developed abroad, since in the Brazilian scenario they present limitations. In this way, a forecast model for the minimum flow of rivers to the West of Bahia was created, between the period of April to October, considered a period of dry season.
modal_info_paraghaph02: Through the use of data from fluviometric stations maintained by the National Water Agency between 1978 - 2017, the model was developed through linear regressions, between the river flow and time variables, to find the slope of these regressions for the each year of each season, used as alpha in equation 1. To predict the behavior of the basin, these alphas were unified for each season.
modal_info_paraghaph03: The relationships found were ordered for the following model:
modal_info_paraghaph04: where Q is the predicted flow, Q<sub>0</sub> is the renaturalized flow in fluviometric stations, α is the slope of the line found in the regressions and t-t<sub>0</sub> the variation of the days of the years.
modal_info_paraghaph05: The modeling results show that the day with the lowest flow rate for the month of April or the lowest flow rate for the month of May can be chosen, but when using the initialization in the month of April, there were cases of overestimation of the data. Already with the start in May, less cases of overestimation occurred, making the month of May more reliable to start the modeling.
modal_info_paraghaph06: Thus, in telemetry stations, which make it possible to generate forecasts in real time, it is possible to apply the minimum flow forecast model for the current year, starting in April, May and June, which we consider to be the end of the rainy season.
modal_info_paraghaph07: The methodology developed by Flávia Barros Vitorino, in her scientific initiation project in the year 2020, together with Professor Marcos Heil of the Federal University of Viçosa.
modal_info_ref01: Zanetti, S. S., Silva, J. M. A. da, Sousa, E. F., Oliveira, V. de P. S. de, & Almeida, F. T. de. (2009). Modelagem hidrológica em microbacia hidrográfica parte I: aprimoramento do modelo HidroBacia. Revista Brasileira de Engenharia Agrícola e Ambiental, 13(4), 429–434.
